2020-08-20-game

In combinatorial game theory, an impartial game is a game in which the allowable moves depend only on the position and not on which of the two players is currently moving, and where the payoffs are symmetric.

(e.g. chess is not impartial

Normal play convention: If the winning condition of the game is that the opponent has no valid moves

Misere play convention: If the winning condition is that the player himself has no valid moves
